titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Taube Archive of the International Military Tribunal (IMT) at Nuremberg, 1945-46 mt839rq8746

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2022-12-05 11:24:08 -0800.

did.unittitle: Taube Archive of the International Military Tribunal (IMT) at Nuremberg

scopecontent.head: Scope and contents
scopecontent.p: The Taube Archive of the International Military Tribunal (IMT) at Nuremberg, 1945-46 collection includes court transcripts, indictments, sentences, briefings, minutes, etc, related to the proceedings of the International Military Tribunal (IMT) at Nuremberg. The first twenty-eight boxes contain: a) Exhibits submitted to the Tribunal by Prosecution and Defense; b) Official Transcripts as taken by Court Reporters, of Court and Commission proceedings; c) Document Books of Prosecution and Defense; d) Trial Briefs, Opening and Closing Statements of Prosecution; e) Final Pleas and Clemency Pleas of Defense; f) Indictment; g) Judgement, Dissenting Opinion and Sentences; h) Minutes of Tribunal Meetings; i) Rules of the Tribunal, Orders of the Tribunal, Court Rulings on the Final Record; and j) Lists, indices and miscellaneous related material. Material was inventoried box by box. The last nine boxes contain only electronic transcriptions of the proceedings before the International Military Tribunal.

The digital collection contains approximately 250,000 pages of digitized paper documents (transcripts of the hearings in English, French, German and Russian; written pleadings; evidence exhibits filed by the prosecution and the defense; documents of the Committee for the Investigation and Prosecution of Major War Criminals; the judgment).

The official archives of the International Military Tribunal of Nuremberg (the "Nuremberg Trial Archives") were entrusted to the International Court of Justice (ICJ) in 1950. The ICJ and its Registry are the custodians of the entire archive, which includes the original print documents that are available in digital form here, audio recordings of the trial's proceedings, and evidentiary films.

p.i: Source: The Registry, International Court of Justice. (2018). Nuremberg Trial Archives, The International Court of Justice: Custodian of the archives of the International Military Tribunal at Nuremberg (2nd ed.) and the United States Holocaust Memorial Museum

scopecontent.title: International Military Tribunal (IMT) Cases
scopecontent.p: The IMT's single case tried 24 defendants, all charged with being "leaders, organizers [and] instigators [of] and accomplices" in the crimes defined in the Charter. They were chosen to represent a cross-section of Nazi diplomatic, economic, political, and military leadership. Adolf Hitler, Heinrich Himmler, and Joseph Goebbels could not be tried because they committed suicide at the end of the war or soon afterwards. Hermann Göring was the highest ranking Nazi official among the defendants.

In the end, only 21 defendants appeared in court. German industrialist Gustav Krupp was included in the original indictment, but he was elderly and in failing health. The Tribunal decided in preliminary hearings to exclude him from the proceedings. Nazi Party secretary Martin Bormann could not be located. Borman was thus tried in absentia. Head of the German Labor Front Robert Ley committed suicide on the eve of the trial. (United States Holocaust Memorial Museum)
Joining the lead defendant, Reichsmarschall and Successor Designate to Hitler, Hermann Wilhelm Göring, were:

ul.li: Rudolf Hess, former Deputy to the Führer
Joachim von Ribbentrop, Reich Minister for Foreign Affairs
Wilhelm Keitel, Chief of the High Command of the German Armed Forces
Ernst Kaltenbrunner, Head of the Reich Main Security Office and highest ranking officer of the Nazi party Schutzstaffel (SS) at Nuremberg
Alfred Rosenberg, racial theory ideologist and Reich Minister for the Eastern Occupied Territories
Hans Frank, Governor General of the Occupied Polish Territories
Wilhelm Frick, Reich Minister of the Interior and Reich Protector for Bohemia and Moravia
Julius Streicher, Editor-in-Chief of the antisemitic newspaper Der Stürmer
Walther Funk, Reich Minister of Economics and President of the German Reichsbank
Hjalmar Schacht, former Reich Minister of Economics and President of the German Reichsbank
Karl Doenitz, Commander-in-Chief of the German Navy and, briefly, successor to Hitler as Head of the German Government
Erich Raeder, former Commander-in-Chief of the German Navy
Baldur von Schirach, Head of the Hitler Youth
Fritz Sauckel, Plenipotentiary of the Nazi slave-labour programme
Alfred Jodl, Chief of the High Command of the German Armed Forces Operations Department
Franz von Papen, former Reich Chancellor and Vice Chancellor
Arthur Seyss-Inquart, Reich Commissar for the Occupied Netherlands
Albert Speer, Reich Minister for Armament and Munitions and Hitler's chief architect
Konstantin von Neurath, Reich Minister of Foreign Affairs and later Reich Protector for Bohemia and Moravia
Hans Fritzsche, Ministerialdirektor of the Reich Ministry of Propaganda

scopecontent.title: International Military Tribunal (IMT) Crimes
scopecontent.p: (a) Crimes against peace: namely, planning, preparation, initiation or waging of a war of aggression, or a war in violation of international treaties, agreements or assurances, or participation in a common plan or conspiracy for the accomplishment of any of the foregoing;

(b) War crimes: namely, violations of the laws or customs of war. Such violations shall include, but not be limited to, murder, ill-treatment or deportation to slave labour or for any other purpose of civilian population of or in occupied territory, murder or ill-treatment of prisoners of war or persons on the seas, killing of hostages, plunder of public or private property, wanton destruction of cities, towns or villages, or devastation not justified by military necessity;

(c) Crimes against humanity: namely, murder, extermination, enslavement, deportation, and other inhumane acts committed against any civilian population, before or during the war, or persecutions on political, racial or religious grounds in execution of or in connection with any crime within the jurisdiction of the Tribunal, whether or not in violation of the domestic law of the country where perpetrated.
The first of these charges, (a), was subdivided in the indictment, which thus contained four counts, of which the defendants each faced his own permutation.

Count one (common plan or conspiracy) was prosecuted by the United States, and count two (crimes against peace) by the United Kingdom. Count three (war crimes) and count four (crimes against humanity) were prosecuted jointly by France and the Soviet Union, according to whether the crimes in question had been committed in Western or Eastern Europe.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Materials in the Nuremberg Trial Archives are made available for online viewing courtesy of the International Court of Justice for non-commercial, personal, research and/or study/educational purposes.
All requests for usage beyond online viewing of the Nuremberg Trial Archives should be directed to the Library of the Court, library@icj-cij.org

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright of the Nuremberg Trial Archives resides with the International Court of Justice.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contemporaneous audio recordings of the complete trial proceedings at the IMT Nuremberg, from reading of the indictments, to opening statements, the presentation and cross-examination of evidence at trial, closing statements and final judgments.

did.unittitle: Lord Justice Lawrence opening session reading of Indictment. Part 1

dao.xlink:title: Lord Justice Lawrence opening session reading of Indictment. Part 1, 1945-11-20 from 10:00 - 10:10

daodesc.p: Lord Justice Lawrence opening session reading of Indictment. Part 1, 1945-11-20 from 10:00 - 10:10

did.unittitle: Tribunal's decision on Hess. Questioning by British prosecutor and German counsels

dao.xlink:title: Tribunal's decision on Hess. Questioning by British prosecutor and German counsels, 1945-12-01 from 10:00 - 10:14

daodesc.p: Tribunal's decision on Hess. Questioning by British prosecutor and German counsels, 1945-12-01 from 10:00 - 10:14

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Note from the ICJ Registry: For this track, the information on the disc label and found in the gramophone disc inventory (the "Index to Electrical Transcriptions of International Military Tribunal", H-5192) does not appear to be accurate. The information provided here is based on a review of the audio.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Compendia of exhibits presented at trial, compiled for judicial review, organized according to defendant.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: PRELIMINARY NOTES TO DOCUMENTS BOOKS AND TRIAL BRIEFS: For purpose of this inventory, Document Books have been identified merely by the name and number of the Document Book. No attempt has been made to catalog the documents contained therein.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: These are digitized images of file folders that were archived originally as a part of the collection, but where the original contents may have been removed or relocated elsewhere before the digitization.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Note: Folder contains only two certificates, and photostat statement that RF 1401 is the same document as RF 1323

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: These records contain documentary and physical evidence that was submitted at trial by the parties to the proceedings as exhibits for judicial review.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Foto-Mappe Nr. 44

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Nazi Plan

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: PRELIMINARY NOTES TO EXHIBITS: In the following Box, exhibit numbers with a dash between are inclusive. For example, "Nos l-6" indicates Nos: l, 2, 3, 4, 5 & 6. Whereas "Nos 1, 6" indicates only the two numbers specified, namely No 1 and No 6.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: These records contain legal pleadings and supporting documentation from defense counsel for the accused, seeking review of judgments and clemency in sentencing.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: PRELIMINARY NOTES TO FINAL PLEAS: The Final Pleas listed below have various titles on the cover pages, such as Final Plea: Closing Arguments, Final Pleading, Final Pleadings, Plea, Pleadings, Plaidoyer, the Case of.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Official charging documents, authored by the prosecution, to indict those accused of crimes under the IMT Nuremberg Charter.

did.unittitle: Indictment against Hermann GOERING et al., lodged with the International Military Tribunal, 6 October 1945

dao.xlink:title: Indictment against Hermann GOERING et al., lodged with the International Military Tribunal, 6 October 1945, 1945-10-06

daodesc.p: Indictment against Hermann GOERING et al., lodged with the International Military Tribunal, 6 October 1945, 1945-10-06

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: PRELIMINARY NOTES TO PROSECUTION CLOSING SPEECHES: The Prosecution Closing Speeches in English have various titles on the cover page, such as: Final Argument, Closing Statement, Final Statement, Final Speech.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: These records contain the final verdicts of the judges at the IMT Nuremberg, including dissenting opinions and sentences rendered against those found guilty of crimes charged.

did.unittitle: Original signed Judgment of the IMT, 1 Oct 1946

dao.xlink:title: Original signed Judgment of the IMT, 1 Oct 1946, 1946-10-01

daodesc.p: Original signed Judgment of the IMT, 1 Oct 1946, 1946-10-01

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: PRELIMINARY NOTES TO PROSECUTION CLOSING SPEECHES: The Prosecution Closing Speeches in English have various titles on the cover page, such as: Final Argument, Closing Statement, Final Statement, Final Speech.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: These materials include compilations and summaries of trial testimony and other evidence presented pertaining to the charges in the trial and the verdicts rendered against the accused.

did.unittitle: SD Affidavits, (a) Letter of Defense Counsel Dr. Gawlik,2 August 1946, requesting translation of SD Affidavits, (b) List of SD Affidavits, (c) Affidavits 1-20

dao.xlink:title: SD Affidavits, (a) Letter of Defense Counsel Dr. Gawlik,2 August 1946, requesting translation of SD Affidavits, (b) List of SD Affidavits, (c) Affidavits 1-20, 1946-08-02

daodesc.p: SD Affidavits, (a) Letter of Defense Counsel Dr. Gawlik,2 August 1946, requesting translation of SD Affidavits, (b) List of SD Affidavits, (c) Affidavits 1-20, 1946-08-02

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: PRELIMINARY NOTES TO AFFIDAVITS: The affidavits in this box presumably relate to the defense of the accused organizations. For classification as to which were exhibits, etc., detailed scrutiny of the affidavits together with related portions of the record will of course be required. The majority of these affidavits are signed originals.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Compendium of minutes recorded contemporaneously of meetings (9 Oct 1945 - 1 Oct 1946) where the judges of the IMT Nuremberg convened to discuss and decide administrative and procedural matters.

did.unittitle: Minutes of International Military Tribunal Meetings, 9 Oct 1945 - 1 Oct 1946, Nos. 1-100

dao.xlink:title: Minutes of International Military Tribunal Meetings, 9 Oct 1945 - 1 Oct 1946, Nos. 1-100, 1945-10-09 to 1946-10-01

daodesc.p: Minutes of International Military Tribunal Meetings, 9 Oct 1945 - 1 Oct 1946, Nos. 1-100, 1945-10-09 to 1946-10-01

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: These are the official transcripts of the Commissions appointed by the IMT for the hearing of witnesses or the presentation of affidavits relating to the accused organizations. Recorded contemporaneously by professional clerks.

did.unittitle: Official Commission Transcript, Robert BRILL, 21 May 1946

dao.xlink:title: Official Commission Transcript, Robert BRILL, 21 May 1946, 1946-05-21

daodesc.p: Official Commission Transcript, Robert BRILL, 21 May 1946, 1946-05-21

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: PRELIMINARY NOTES TO OFFICIAL TRANSCRIPT OF THE COMMISSIONS: Box 8 contains the Official Transcript of the Commissions appointed by the IMT for the hearing of witnesses or the presentation of Affidavits relating to the accused organizations. The inventory below indicates either the name of the witness or the accused organization.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: These records are contemporaneous transcription of live courtroom proceedings at the IMT Nuremberg, recorded by professional clerks of the tribunal and archived with the records of trial.

dao.xlink:title: Vol. 38: Official Court Transcript, 27-31 August 1946, 1946-08-27 to 1946-08-31

daodesc.p: Vol. 38: Official Court Transcript, 27-31 August 1946, 1946-08-27 to 1946-08-31

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: PRELIMINARY NOTES TO RUSSIAN TRANSCRIPTS: The Russian Transcripts are bound in 39 volumes containing the authentic Russian text either typewritten or mimeographed. In each volume are found one or more unnumbered pages: the table of contents (sometimes pasted on outside of cover, sometimes inserted in volume in loose form), Russian certificates and sometimes English certificates.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Rules of procedure and evidence promulgated by the IMT Nuremberg to govern the proceedings of trial.

did.unittitle: Incomplete copies of International Military Tribunal Orders

dao.xlink:title: Incomplete copies of International Military Tribunal Orders

daodesc.p: Incomplete copies of International Military Tribunal Orders

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: These are the text of the opening and closing statements delivered by prosecuting attorneys at the trial.

did.unittitle: Introduction to French Closing Speech on responsibility of Defendants, by Mr. Champetier de Ribes

dao.xlink:title: Introduction to French Closing Speech on responsibility of Defendants, by Mr. Champetier de Ribes

daodesc.p: Introduction to French Closing Speech on responsibility of Defendants, by Mr. Champetier de Ribes

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: PRELIMINARY NOTES TO PROSECUTION CLOSING SPEECHES: The Prosecution Closing Speeches in English have various titles on the cover page, such as: "Closing Address", "Final Speech", "Final Address", "Final statement".

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: These trial briefs are official court filings authored by the U.S. and British prosecution teams making legal arguments about particular defendants, incidents, and theories of liability.

did.unittitle: U.S. Trial Brief LL against the Defendant Wilhelm FRICK

dao.xlink:title: U.S. Trial Brief LL against the Defendant Wilhelm FRICK

daodesc.p: U.S. Trial Brief LL against the Defendant Wilhelm FRICK

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: PRELIMINARY NOTES TO DOCUMENTS BOOKS AND TRIAL BRIEFS: For purpose of this inventory, Document Books and Trial briefs have been identified merely by the name and letter. No attempt has been made to catalog the documents contained therein or to count the pages.
